title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: This one won't start from battery and it won't show anything on the battery indicator. With magsafe connected it starts and charges the battery. There is no X on the battery icon. It runs from battery if magsafe is disconnected. Nothing changes if I disconnect the BIL

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: Voltage on PPBUS_G3H only battery?? Battery status on OSX?? Could be bad Q7055...

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: PPBUS_G3H 12,15 volt with only battery. Battery status on OS X is normal

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: It does show all the info about battery??? Cicles, amp, etc...??

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
yes, but indicator on the side doesn't work.
My guess right now is R5280 or R5281

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: or maybe not....

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: Try other BIL...

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: have done that. The big problem is that it wont start from battery. Don't think that BIL need to be connected to start from battery

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: Something is pulling down SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL . I get 1.5 volt at pin four on the battery connector. On another bord with same battery I get 3,4 volt

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: Measure in diode mode SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL and SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA and report values....

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: SCL is 0,497 and SDA is 0,500

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: There is nothing wrong with the data bus if the battery is recognized fully in OSX. I doubt you checked this as the BIL does not work and there is no power from battery. Check the pull up resistors and otherwise it is dead SMC/ISL6259

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
When the computer is running SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL goes up to 3,4 volt. But when it is off it's only 1,5.
checked three other macbooks and they are all showing 3,4 when off.

[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] Dont understand what you meen with this "I doubt you checked this as the BIL does not work and there is no power from battery"
It works from battery but it wont start from battery.

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: SMC or ISL. It will not stay on from battery I bet.

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: if R5280 is normal, Bat connector looks clean, BIL change has not effect, and PPV3V42 is present... I would try replacing D6950, Zenor's can be a bit funny

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
This One almost work now. It boots from battery. 
The problem is that the fan starts spinning before login screen. And after a few minutes the coursor is hacking and everything feels slow. When i run it without the battery its all good. I have tried different trackpads, bil-connectors and batteries with no luck.

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
Try other HDD.
Also try your USB test OSX, disconnecting flex for internal HDD.
Fan still start high if you leave the machine waiting in boot menu?

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
Yes, fan speed is high in boot menu. Asd efi and asd os show no errors. 
It works perfect without battery.

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
Connect the battery whitout seating it into the case (on top of trackpad); let the battery out of case.
Fan still high without battery?

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: I?m 90% sure the problem is on the logicboard. But I dont Know exactly how the battery circuit works.

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of ISL6259 with both, battery and charger connected.

"Fan still high without battery?"
???

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: ?It works perfect without battery?

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
"Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of ISL6259 with both, battery and charger connected."
???

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
Pin 15 0,053v
pin 9 0,66-0,69 pulsing up and down
at fuse with only battery it?s pulsing between 11,67-11,74

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
"pin 9 0,66-0,69 pulsing up and down"
Is that reading with both charger and battery connected, in off state?
If not, check it now.
Also post PPBUS_G3H voltage in the same condition.

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message: Need to sleep... I?ll check tomorrow. Thanks for your help

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
When off, pin 9 is 0,5v and pin 15 is 0
ppbus_g3h is 12,49

title: 2936 won't start from battery
message:
"pin 9 is 0,5v and pin 15 is 0"
Something is strange there, AMON is too high; battery doesn't seem to sink current.
So check again R7021/22 and their traces to ISL6259 and R7020.
Also check pin9 without battery connected.
